Grouped_Utterances: I’ve been okay. I practiced mindfulness and reached out to some contacts. I got a response from one of my classmates, and they mentioned a job opening at a daycare! I feel hopeful, but I’m also nervous about applying. I guess I worry that I won’t be good enough for the position. I’ve been trying to focus on the positives, but some days are still tough. I think we’re getting closer. I’m more present with her, and I try to listen more. I want to be more patient with her when she gets upset.
Yes! We went to the park last weekend, and we had a picnic. It was nice. Yes, I want to take her to see a movie next week.

I think I’m good for now. I feel like I’ve made progress. You’ve made wonderful progress! I’m so proud of you. Let’s keep building on this momentum in our next session. I look forward to hearing about your application!

I could look at my list of accomplishments or repeat my affirmations before applying. One technique is deep breathing. When you feel yourself getting frustrated, taking a moment to breathe can help you respond calmly. Would you like to practice that together?

Absolutely! Practicing that can help you pause before reacting. Would you like to set a goal to practice this technique when you feel overwhelmed? Yes, that sounds good. I’ll try to remember to breathe before reacting.
